page.title: 01THE SURVEY AREA
page.content: OUR AREA IS RURAL WITH SMALL, SCATTERED VILLAGES, THE LARGEST BEING GREAT BENTLEY WITH ITS GREEN OF 45 ACRES, SAID TO BE THE LARGEST IN THE COUNTRY. THE SURROUNDING VILLAGES OF FRATING, THORRINGTON AND AINGERS GREEN ARE ALL SMALL WITH A POST OFFICE CUM GENERAL STORE AS THEIR ONLY SHOP. THE COUNTRYSIDE IS LOW LYING AND VIRTUALLY FLAT, BORDERING ON COASTAL SALT MARSHES TO THE EAST. FARMING IN MANY AND VARIED FORMS IS THE MAINSTAY OF THE AREA, WITH LARGE AREAS OF DECIDUOUS WOODLAND. ONE OF THE MAIN FEATURES OF THE AREA IS THE EARLY NORMAN CHURCH AT GREAT BENTLEY, ADDED TO OVER THE YEARS, BUT RETAINING MANY OF ITS ORIGINAL FEATURES. THE AREA IS PART OF THE TENDRING PENINSULAR, MID-WAY BETWEEN THE EAST COAST RESORTS OF CLACTON AND WALTON AND THE HISTORIC TOWN OF COLCHESTER.
